description: A simple meatball recipe that is easy to prepare and versatile for various dishes.
ingredients: [{"name": "lean ground beef", "units": "lb", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "Progresso Italian Style Bread Crumbs", "units": "cup", "amount": "1/2"}, {"name": "2% milk", "units": "cup", "amount": "1/4"}, {"name": "salt", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": "1/2"}, {"name": "Worcestershire sauce", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": "1/2"}, {"name": "pepper", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": "1/4"}, {"name": "small onion, finely chopped", "units": "small", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "large egg", "units": null, "amount": "1"}]
instructions: 1. Heat oven to 400°F. Line 13x9-inch pan with foil; spray with cooking spray. 2. In large bowl, mix all ingredients just until combined. 3. Shape mixture into 24 (1 1/2-inch) meatballs by rolling into balls between the palms of your hands, using a meat baller, or a cookie scoop. 4. Place meatballs 1 inch apart on a baking sheet with sides. 5. Bake uncovered 18 to 22 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 160°F and meatballs are no longer pink in the center. 6. Serve over pasta and top with your favorite sauce.
notes: If desired, substitute 1 lb lean ground turkey or chicken for the ground beef. Using a jar of store-bought pasta sauce is one of our favorite dinnertime shortcuts.
tags: meatballs, beef, main course, easy recipe
